results.title: The Wheelwright
results.creator_credit: David Cons, G. Buckland-Smith and Worshipful Company of Wheelwright
results.brief_description: Film of one of the few remaining wheelwrights in Britain making a wheel. This is contrasted with the making of wheels for modern motor cars.

results.title: The Whale savers
results.creator_credit: Alex Dumas, Laurie Levy, Neal Bethune and Levy-Bethune Productions
results.brief_description: Presents an overview of the work of conservationists Laurie Levy and Neal Bethune established the Whale Rescue Centre in Melbourne. They argue against the view that whales mass suicide and stress attempts should be made to save them. Includes footage of both successful and unsucessful attempts to rescue stranded whales on the Victorian and Tasmanian coasts. Narrated by Lynda Stoner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alex Dumas, Laurie Levy, Neal Bethune and Levy-Bethune Productions

results.title: The Water miners
results.brief_description: An examination of the large hydro-electric power scheme envisaged for the Gordon River system in Tasmania. Shows exploration of the area, building of roads and camps, and the work of all the hydrologists and engineers. The plan is to build dams in the steep gorges to catch water to turn the turbines.
results.description: An examination of the large hydro-electric power scheme envisaged for the Gordon River system in Tasmania. Shows exploration of the area, building of roads and camps, and the work of all the hydrologists and engineers. The plan is to build dams in the steep gorges to catch water to turn the turbines.

results.title: The Water famine
results.creator_credit: Jack Beck and Columbia Broadcasting System Television
results.brief_description: The role of water in the birth and decay of civilization and the problems of man as he searches for new sources. The critical water shortage and the population explosion; the problems of pollution; desalinization demonstrated by the “flash freezing” process used in Israel and the electro-dialysis process used in the United States.

results.title: The Water Babies
results.brief_description: When Tom is unfairly blamed for stealing, he escapes by leaping into the water of Dead Man’s Pool. There he and his dog Toby become cartoons in an animated world of fantasy, adventure and songs, befriending the Water Babies and helping to save them from the dreaded Shark and Electric Eel. Starring James Mason, Joan Greenwood and David Tomlinson.

results.title: The Warm coat
results.brief_description: The documentary account of the airlifting of sea otter from the Bering sea to Alaskan coves, an environment which will offer the animals a better chance to thrive and multiply.

results.title: The Walrus and the carpenter
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Spaull, Thomas Gasek and MS&TG
results.brief_description: An animated adaptation of Lewis Carroll’s whimsical poem in which the walrus and the carpenter entice a family of oysters to join them in their journey along the beach. Uses puppet animation. Narrated by Guy Spaull.

results.title: The Waiting people
results.brief_description: Captures the plight refugees in Europe after World War II who have lost their nationality. Since the end of the War, many have been forced to remain indefinitely in refugee camps due to illness or disability. Consequently, many are considered unacceptable as immigrants to other countries. Narrated by James McKechnie; accomplished cinematography by Edward Wooldridge.
